newsitem.title: SWEDEN: FORECAST - Ericsson '96 profit up 32 pct.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Ericsson '96 profit up 32 pct.

text.p: Swedish telecoms group AB LM Ericsson was expected to post a higher pre-tax profit of 10.03 billion crowns for calendar 1996, a Reuters poll of 18 analysts showed on Wednesday.
A year earlier Ericsson made a pre-tax profit of 7.62 billion crowns and in the first nine months of 1996 its profit reached 6.26 billion crowns.
Forecasts for 1996 ranged from 9.44 billion crowns to 11.00 billion crowns. The average forecast would mean a rise in pre-tax profits of 32 percent.
Profit per share was expected to rise to 6.95 crowns while sales revenue was forecast at 117.50 billion crowns.
The average dividend forecast from the analysts was for a payment of 2.05 crowns a share compared to 1.75 crowns a year before.

Analysts interviewed for the poll were from Aragon, Aros, Carnegie, Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, Enskilda, Fiba, Fischer, Foreningsbanken, Handelsbanken, James Capel, Kleinwort Benson, Lehman Brothers, Matteus, Merrill Lynch, Paribas, Penser, SBC Warburg and Swedbank.
Ericsson is due to release its 1996 earnings on February 11.
